data.text: @NSValley @WitchyMedium111 I was there for my first shot, super well organized and moved loads of people through smoothly

@WitchyMedium111 They've been holding vaccine clinics there since they first started in the Valley.  It's a very large church hall that can accommodate many people with distancing. It's where my mother received her first shot and where many other people I know have gone.

@WitchyMedium111 @SmrtCanuck It’s a major site staffed by the province.  It was one of the prototype clinics and is rather huge. They have a large space to accommodate lots of stations.  Not sure why there and not the New Minas Community Center next door, but their parking lot is 3x the size and empty

@WitchyMedium111 I think those bookings just got added this afternoon.  It may be that there's been lower numbers of people from that community getting vaccinated so they sent some extra supply there to make it easier. No reason to travel far now, we'll have more in a couple weeks.
@WitchyMedium111 Funny, that's the only place around that seems to have  Pfizer right now.  I'm not going that far for it though, I expect to see a lot of appointments open up by the 25th.
